entry.string: The Administration section of the Ledger module lets you manage master tables and other data that normally do not change during day-to-day operations, or that are naturally reserved to be viewed and changed by the administrator(s) of the accounting system.
In general access to these areas should be restricted to persons with an advanced understanding of accounting and a working knowledge of the Ledger module.
You can define master tables for the Ledger module such as applicable currencies and the chart of accounts. In some cases these allow import and export of XML data.
Following the Modify Config link you can set default values for the system, such as accounts for posting or applicable taxes.

The Ledger module works on the basis of a cascading series of default values. If a required value cannot be found at a lower level, it is looked for at higher levels until an appropriate value is found.

As an example take the applicable VAT for an invoice. Under Modify Config a global default can be set for VAT, When a customer is created this value is initially assumed unless another VAT is entered.
In turn when an invoice is raised, the initial VAT value is defaulted to the rate of the customer the invoice is applied to, until it is manually changed.
